answers.answer: Blood tests do not test for STDs unless you specifically request this.  Next time you get these sores, I would see your doc immediately so they can do a viral culture for HSV.  If you cannot get an appt with your doc right away, try to get to an STD clinic or immediate care center.  The sores you are describing sound closer to herpes than syphilis, but I can really not say.  Also, it probably wouldn't be a bad idea to get tested for other STDs too.  I'm not sure what the headaches/dizziness are from...see another doctor for a second opinion if they continue.Good luck,Em

I would stay on top of the blood pressure, because that can cause dizziness and headaches.What you describe doesn't sound like syphilis, but does sound like herpes.  I would ask your doc to test you for both syphilis and herpes.  You can get a type specific IgG herpes blood test, and that is accurate even if you don't have symptoms at the time.You might also talk to your doc about just having a nurse culture the sores, or having it noted that you can get in the same day you get symptoms.AJ

question: Hi there,about 3 years ago I started getting sores/spots on my bottom.  They would appear every 1-2 months for round about 2 weeks at a time.  I still get them now but only every 3-4 months for 4-5 days.  They always re-appear in the same place.  Also 2 years ago I started getting headaches and dizzy spells  which got progressively worse.  I am now on tablets for lowering my blood pressure.  I had blood tests done which I think were to check for diabetes and such.  The only thing that resulted out of the tests was that I had a low count of red blood cells.  Would the test have picked up any STD's or does it have to be a specific test to find this?  I have been a regular with a sex-worker so I think chances of an STD is high.  At the time I mentioned the sores but the doctor couldn't see them as they were "gone" during examination and it's very difficult to time an appointment when they are back especially when it takes a week to get an appointment.  The main thing I am worried about is the headaches and dizziness which the doctor can't explain.
title: Could I have Syphilis?
